physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient appeared restless; remainder of the physical examination was normal.

physical_examinations.date: Three weeks before the current presentation
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Joints of the hands, wrists, and elbows were normal; neurologic examination was normal; remainder of the physical examination was normal.

Patient appeared jaundiced with marked scleral icterus; mucous membranes were moist. Abdomen was soft and nondistended with mild tenderness on palpation of the upper right quadrant; no hepatosplenomegaly. No gynecomastia, caput medusae, or spider angiomata; no asterixis; no rash or leg edema.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient's appearance of jaundice and scleral icterus is a progression from previous symptomatology.
